pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:0.5: 12. The second training rule on laughing loudly
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were laughing loudly while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:1.3.1: “‘I will not laugh loudly while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:1.4: One should not laugh loudly while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, laughs loudly while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:1.11: if he merely smiles when something is funny;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk12:1.15: The second training rule is finished.
